content:
Diagnosis
	1. T4aN2cM1 squamous cell carcinoma of oral tongue
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Pembrolizumab 200mg + Cisplatin 100mg/m2 + 5FU 1000mg/m2 q21 days
	Cycle 1-3: Jan-Mar 2024
	2. Single agent Pembrolizumab 200mg q21 days from April 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging

	Current issues
	1. Grade 2 mucositis
	2. Declining oral intake
	3. Weight loss

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] attended clinic today with his wife. CT scan from 15/5/24 shows stable disease in primary tumor and metastatic sites compared to March 2024. However, he has experienced significant deterioration in oral intake over past 3 weeks due to progressive local symptoms. Weight has dropped 4kg to 62kg. Now requiring regular oral morphine solution for pain control.

Examination shows extension of tumor involving right lateral tongue and floor of mouth with areas of necrosis. No airway compromise. Multiple firm right cervical nodes. PS remains 2.

Discussed case at Head & Neck MDT today. Given stable systemic disease but local progression, plan for palliative radiotherapy 30Gy in 10 fractions to oral cavity, continuing pembrolizumab during RT. Will need nasogastric feeding tube insertion prior to RT start.

	Further investigations
	None required

	Medication prescribed
	Oramorph 10mg/5ml solution

	Follow up
	Urgent radiotherapy planning appointment next week
Review in combined clinic with RT team in 2 weeks

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function and electrolytes weekly
Referral to community palliative care team requested
